item.description:
Description:
Join us for a day of kayaking at beautiful Lake Waramaug in New Preston Ct.!!! A large,GORGEOUS lake that has something for everyone!!!
Kayaks are available for rent at a decent price, so even if you don't own one you can still join the fun!

ALr's comment:
These are the stable kind and another chance for those who didnt really fit well with mine to have a relaxing fit.

or there is a small beach there for sunning...

I will bring all of my kayaks, but you have to reserve the one you know you can paddle...

ok back to AnnMaries listing;

For those with yaks, the launch facility is along side the road (not a great one) and then you have to move your vehicle to the parking lot across the street. WE WILL MEET UP NEAR THE RENT A KAYAK AREA !
There is an entrance fee to the park if you don't have a state park pass! Please be there and ready to paddle by 11:00. I will be wearing a pink Yankee hat and you can reach my cell #860-309-3933 if there are any problems!

Directions:From Litchfield- follow rt.118 to Litchfield. At the intersections of rts. 118 and 202 in Litchfield bear left onto rt.202. Follow rt.202 to New Preston. Take a right onto rt.45 and than a left onto North Shore road. Continue around lake to the park, taking Lake Warmamaug road to the lake Waramaug State park entrance, its just past the campground .

another way in is off of rte 45 you can take North Shore road to Lake Warmaug Rd..
BUT as ALWAY LOOK AT YOUR MAPS FIRST..its a long way and ya dont want to waste the trip...

It may be a drive for some...but its soooo worth it!

For mapquest/gps or others, use 300 Lake Waramaug Road, New Preston, CT to get you close enough.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Kayaking Lake Waramaug With AnnMarie, Extra details
